Issues.Title: Document difference between EventEmitter and Subject
Issues.Body:
There is no documentation about the difference between `Subject` and `EventEmitter`. AFAIK, the only differences are EventEmitter's duplicative `emit()` and optional asynchronous mode.

Of the two, `Subject` is shorter, better documented, and is not unique to Angular, so I always prefer `Subject`.

I have no idea if I am getting something important wrong by doing this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Document difference between EventEmitter and Subject" (#29499)

Issues.Title: navigationId inside RouteReuseStrategy
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/router

### Description
I would like to have the navigationId available inside the RouteReuseStrategy to create a stack of pages.
The use case: Suppose I have a page that I can use to search a specific contact. I select contactttype "Accountmanager" and I know the CEO of the company he works for. So from this page I jump to a page to lookup a company. I don't know the company-name but I know the CEO. So from this page I jump to lookup a contact. I find the CEO, i hit "select". I come back in the page to lookup a company and the CEO is shown in the filter. I find my company, I hit select and I come back in the page to find contacts. My selection "Account Manager" is still present and the company name is added to the filter.
I want these pages to be stored in my RouteReuseStrategy but I can't use the URL because it's not unique.
My application is thus a stack of pages. While looking for information I open new pages in the same browserwindow that are added to the stack and as i find stuff I pop the pages from the stack, but the URL cannot be used to identify these pages.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like to use the navigationId to create a map of DetachedRouteHandle so I would like this parameter to be passed to the methods of the RouteReuseStrategy interface.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I could add an id to every URL to simulate the navigationId but that seems awkward.
I've tried to access the navigationId from ActivatedRouteSnapshot but I cannot obtain it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "navigationId inside RouteReuseStrategy" (#29498)

Issues.Title: Angular animation :leave not triggered
Issues.Body:
I have a tooltip component with animations in which the `:enter` animation is working as expected but the `:leave` animation never triggered.

Here is a link to stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/building-tooltip-eoby9e?file=src/app/tooltip/tooltip.component.ts

```
  animations: [
    trigger('tooltip', [
      transition(':enter', [
        style({ opacity: 0 }),
        animate(300, style({ opacity: 1 })),
      ]),
      transition(':leave', [
        animate(300, style({ opacity: 0 })),
      ]),
    ]),
  ],
```

Angular version: 7.1.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular animation :leave not triggered" (#29496)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): TestBed rewrite to avoid unnecessary recompilations
Issues.Body:
This is WIP PR, more tests will be added.

Prior to this change, Ivy version of TestBed was not designed to support the logic to avoid recompilations - most of the Components/Directives/Pipes were recompiled for each test, even if there were no overrides defined for a given Type. Additional checks to avoid recompilation were introduced in one of the previous commits (0244a2433e2d7009d98bc589899edcd5b1fa003f), but there were still some corner cases that required attention. In order to support the necessary logic better, Ivy TestBed was rewritten/refactored. Main results of this rewrite are:

* no recompilation for Components/Directives/Pipes without overrides
* the logic to restore state between tests (isolate tests) was improved
* transitive scopes calculation no longer performs recompilation (it works with compiled defs)

As a result of these changes we see reduction in memory consumption (3.5-4x improvement) and performance increase (4-4.5x improvement).

This work is a join effort of @alxhub (thanks Alex!) and myself.

This PR resolves FW-1178.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): properly check LView array size in binding asserts
Issues.Body:

value being compared to an array length and buggy type coercion.

Fixing this bug speeds up test scenario by ~10-15%.

```
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
The new Architect API is almost here and it takes into consideration external developers such as myself (@hansl great job!).  
For instance, there is `transforms` object in [browser](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/browser/index2.ts#L212) and [dev-server](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index2.ts#L77) builders which allows me to easily extend them with custom webpack configuration ([custom-webpack:browser](https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders/blob/new-architect-api/packages/custom-webpack/src/browser/index2.ts), [custom-webpack:dev-server](https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders/blob/new-architect-api/packages/custom-webpack/src/dev-server/index.ts)).  
It made the transition from 7.x.x to 8.x.x very easy end the API itself is very robust.  
However, this is not the case for karma and server builders (which are must-have to complete the transition).   
The only function I can reuse from [server](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts) builder is [`buildServerWebpackConfig`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts#L107) but even with this reuse I have to copy&modify the rest of the logic.  
When it comes to [karma](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/karma/index2.ts) builder I don't think I can reuse anything from there, meaning I have to copy&modify the whole file.  

### Describe the solution you'd like
Karma and Server builders should provide the same level of flexibility and behave similarly to Browser and Dev-Server builders.  
In particular, take in the `transforms` object, export the logic that can be potentially reused by external developers and use the same way for creating a builder (`createBuilder` function from `'@angular-devkit/architect/src/index2'` and not something custom like [here](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts#L44)).
### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only alternative I have today is to copy and paste the code from Karma and Server builder and start modifying it.  
I hope we all agree that this is very hard to maintain and can't be a long term option.  
In fact, it would be really great if I didn't have to do it and I could reuse all the necessary logic before the RC is out.  

@clydin @mgechev Guys, @hansl told me that I should ask you for help about the coordination so here I'm asking.  
We can discuss it here, or if you need more details I'm on `#tools-friends` channel at Slack.

Thanks a lot for doing such an amazing job!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Dev Kit 8.x.x: make server and karma builder reusable by external developers" (#13972)

Issues.Title: fileReplacements cannot replace app.module.ts (ng build --configuration=production)
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Not sure. hadn't tried this before ### Description fileReplacements cannot replace app.module.ts command used: ng build --configuration=production got this error: ERROR in : Type AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts! Please consider moving AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts to a higher module that imports AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts. You can also create a new NgModule that exports and includes AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts then import that NgModule in AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Simple steps to reproduce this bug. 1. Create a new project using `ng new`. 2. Create two components `ng g c app/components/home` `ng g c app/components/feature`. 3. Make a copy of app.module.ts file and name it app.module.prod.ts file. 4. Remove `import { FeatureComponent } from './app/components/feature/feature.component';` from app.module.prod.ts. Reason is feature component is not needed in production. 5. Run `ng build --configuration=production` You can clone the following repo and run `ng build --configuration=production` https://github.com/Jun711/replaceAppModule ## üî• Exception or Error 
/Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts! Please consider moving AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts to a higher module that imports AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts. You can also create a new NgModule that exports and includes AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts then import that NgModule in AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts.
## üåç Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 7.2.4
Node: 11.0.0
OS: darwin x64

... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic

Issues.Title: raw-loader not working with "aot": true and "buildOptimizer": true
Issues.Body:
Currently in my components I have code like 
```
import * as leftMenuTemplate from '!raw-loader!./templates/_left-menu.html';

@Component({
selector: 'my-component',
template: `
    <aside class="main-sidebar">
      <section class="sidebar">${leftMenuTemplate}</section>
    </aside>
   `
})
```
everything works fine if I build with  "aot": false and "buildOptimizer": false but everything fails if I build with "aot": true and "buildOptimizer": true

**_When I try to run with AOT true I get the null string rendered instead of my menu._**

Issues.Title: Call ng [serve | build] with a platform flag
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

It would be great to be able to add extensions to `ng serve` and `ng build`, which would allow me to call a custom serve/build mechanism.

This would be very useful with NativeScript where the developers need to use two CLIs, the Angular CLI for generating components, services etc. and the NativeScript to build and deploy the apps.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

When I am in a NativeScript Angular project (or a code-sharing project web+mobile), it would be great to be able to call something like:
`ng serve --ios` or `ng serve --flag=android`, which would then ask the architect on how to perform the build iOS or Android build and deploy the app.

It would also be great to do the same with `ng build --ios`, which would perform a full mobile build.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

What I am looking after is a mechanism that would allow me to plug into the Angular CLI, and then extend it with additional build options.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use `sass` instead of `node-sass`
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE: we no longer use `node-sass` by default, instead we use `sass` (dart-sass).

While in most cases this should not have an impact the generated code, dart sass has some differences from Ruby Sass. See https://github.com/sass/dart-sass#behavioral-differences-from-ruby-sass for more details

If you wish to use `node-sass` instead of `sass` you need to install node-sass as a dev dependency.

npm users
```
npm install node-sass --save-dev
```

yarn users
```
yarn add node-sass --dev
```


**Note**: for larger Sass projects to avoid this performance hit you might want to install `fibers`. See: https://www.npmjs.com/package/fibers


Ref: TOOL-748
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use `sass` instead of `node-sass`" (#13950)

Issues.Title: Support core-js@3.0.0
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
core-js 3.0.0 [is released](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/releases), but `ng serve` fails with error
```
ERROR in ./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/jit-polyfills.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'core-js/es7/reflect' in 'C:\Work\frontend\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\angular-cli-files\models'
```

With `core-js@3.0.0` it's `import 'core-js/proposals/reflect-metadata';`

Workaround: Add this to your tsconfig.json:
```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "paths": {
      "core-js/es7/reflect": ["node_modules/core-js/proposals/reflect-metadata"],
      "core-js/es6/*": ["node_modules/core-js/es/*"]
    }
  }
}
```


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

Issues.Title: `baseUrl` flag in protractors schema is deprecated
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

Please do not deprecate and remove the `baseUrl` flag in the protractor schema.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ x ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
In our CI/CD system, we run our e2e tests as a part of our pre-merge validations, which include deploying the SPA configured to run against our staging API. In order to do this cleanly, and without namespace conflicts/races, we give each of these applications their own base-href, as follows:

```
ng build
    --configuration=staging
    --output-path=./dist-e2e
    --base-href=/ci-cd-draft-build-${JOB_NUMBER}/
```

This is then uploaded to S3, and tested as follows:
```
ng e2e --baseUrl=https://<s3-bucket>/ci-cd-draft-build-${JOB_NUMBER}/
```
We also use these draft builds to perform Beta feature usability tests, product demos, and a variety of other activities that are greatly enhanced by having a fully functioning UI. Similarly, we publish whitelabel UI's for our customers, which we also run protractor-driven acceptance tests against, and whose base-url's vary greatly.

Just now, I noticed this message:
```
Option "baseUrl" is deprecated: Use "baseUrl" in the Protractor config file instead.
```
Which I traced to the following entry in the protractor schematic.
```
    "baseUrl": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Base URL for protractor to connect to.",
      "x-deprecated": "Use \"baseUrl\" in the Protractor config file instead."
    }
```
As our `buildUrl` value is not known ahead of time, we cannot easily use the protractor config file; while we could attempt to inject it via some form of environment parameter, modifying environment parameters is more cumbersome than adding a commandline flag.

### Describe the solution you'd like
We do not want this flag to be removed. It's not harming anyone, why is it being removed?

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Writing a configuration file for CI/CD, for every customer, environment, and build target we have. This will litter our project with config files, and we'd really like to avoid that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`baseUrl` flag in protractors schema is deprecated" (#13952)

Issues.Title: feat(@ngtools/webpack): update `require` statements to work with webp‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ack raw-loader v2.

webpack raw-loader released a breaking change https://github.com/webpack-contrib/raw-loader/releases/tag/v2.0.0 and now they use ES Module export instead of CommonJS.

BREAKING CHANGE: we now support only raw-loader version 2+ as the emitted code has changed to support version 2 of the mentioned loader.

Before
```
Component({
    selector: 'app-root',
    template: require("!raw-loader!./app.component.html"),
    styles: [require("./app.component.css")]
})
```

Now
```
Component({
    selector: 'app-root',
    template: require("!raw-loader!./app.component.html").default,
    styles: [require("./app.component.css").default]
})
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@ngtools/webpack): update `require` statements to work with webp‚Ä¶" (#13949)

Issues.Title: Support `import()` syntax for loadChildren in ViewEngine
Issues.Body:
This feature ONLY matches the format below:
```
loadChildren: () => import('IMPORT_STRING').then(m => m.EXPORT_NAME)
```

It will not match nor alter variations, for instance:
- not using arrow functions
- not using `m` as the module argument
- using `await` instead of `then`
- using a default export (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/11402)

The only parts that can change are the ones in caps: IMPORT_STRING and EXPORT_NAME.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Support `import()` syntax for loadChildren in ViewEngine" (#13948)

Issues.Title: material button toggle/ switch between two icons.
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Buttons are often used to toggle state. Toggling state often comes with the need of changing the icon inside the button.
this
`<button (click)="toggleState = !toggleState" mat-button>{{ toggleState ? 'more_vert' : 'more_horiz' }}</button>`

Does not work for obvious reasons.

instead I would have to go caveman style:

`<button *ngIf="toggleState" (click)="toggleState = !toggleState" mat-button>more_vert</button>
<button *ngIf="!toggleState" (click)="toggleState = !toggleState" mat-button>more_horiz</button>`

Would be cool to have something like this:

`<button #button (click)="toggleState = !toggleState; button.toggleIcon()" secondIcon="more_horiz" mat-button>more_vert</button>`

(if possible a "transition" animation from icon to icon could happen. I know that's a tough one since "svg nodes" need to line up beween icons etc ...)



#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "material button toggle/ switch between two icons." (#15578)

Issues.Title: mat-form-fields not matching Material color specs for hovering
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
According to the latest version of the Google Material spec, hovering for "fill" inputs should be 1dp/grey-700 and for "outline" inputs 1dp/grey-300.

#### What is the current behavior?
For elements using mat-form-field with appearance="fill", "standard" or "outline", the hover-state border is 2dp/rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.87). This is significantly darker than the specification color and has the wrong weight.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
This current behavior should be readily visible in any mat-form-field that uses any of the 3 aforementioned appearances.

Here is the example usage from the Angular Material site.
https://stackblitz.com/angular/epjajgjbbve?file=app%2Fform-field-appearance-example.ts


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular Material: 7.3.5
Chrome: 72.0.3626.121 (should still be reproducible on others)
OS: Linux (should still be reproducible on others)

"dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/common": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/compiler": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/core": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/elements": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/forms": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@webcomponents/custom-elements": "^1.1.0",
    "core-js": "^2.6.1",
    "rxjs": "^6.4.0",
    "systemjs": "0.19.43",
    "tsickle": "^0.34.0",
    "tslib": "^1.9.3",
    "zone.js": "^0.8.29"
  },

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This has already been discussed beforehand with @mmalerba.

Issues.Title: Angular Material Typography using pixels instead of rem
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using Angular's Typography inside '_theming.scss' ends up using pixels. I believe the best would be for this to instead convert the pixels to 'rem'. 

Rem is very important when it comes to accessibility concerns. If the user goes to the browser settings and changes the font size to very large the text in the application should scale accordingly.

As 'rem' is much stronger than pixels when it comes to accessibility I am a bit surprised this is not implemented in this manner. I believe this change would only make a positive impact, currently I am in the debate of using this because of this problem as we will be then failing some accessibility guidelines. 

#### What is the expected behavior?
The text in the application after using Angular's Typography should be converting pixels provided to rem for accessibility for when the user goes to adjust the browsers font size from medium (default) to another such as large.

#### What is the current behavior?
Angular Typography uses pixels. This prevents the application font-size from scaling when the user has trouble seeing and wishes to scale the font size up through the browser.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
 1. Create new Angular Application
 2. Add Angular Material Typography to the application with default values provided by the Angular guide [here](https://material.angular.io/guide/typography)
 3. In your app components html add a simple h1 with typography class added:
    <h1 class="mat-display-1">Header Text For Testing<h1 class="mat-display-1">
 4. Inspect the h1 tag through Google Chrome
 5. You will see something similar to this: 400 34px/40px Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Accessibility 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Accessibility is an important part of an application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material Typography using pixels instead of rem" (#15580)

Issues.Title: MatDialog not working properly on pageload on NgUniversal (ssr)
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
MatDialog should behave the same on a ssr application

#### What is the current behavior?
On SSR, when MatDialog is triggered (`this.dialog.open()`) on **pageload** (`ngOnInit`) two `<cdk-overlay-container>` is generated in the DOM. When trying to close it (`this.dialog.close()`) only one instance is responding to it. The other one still remain in the DOM. Which leaves the user with a dialog on the screen which can not been closed.

Issues.Title: Clicking autocomplete field after clear doesn't show dropdown list
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Clicking the cleared autocomplete input field should show the dropdown list.

#### What is the current behavior?
After clearing the autocomplete field using a clear button that sets the input value to null or '', clicking the cleared input field will not show the dropdown list. The dropdown list will show if the user clicks the label above the input field, clicks very close to the top side of the input line, or clicks away from the input then back into the input field. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-srhd19?embed=1&file=app/autocomplete-simple-example.html
1. Select an item from the list.
2. Use the clear button to clear the input.
3. Click in the middle of the input field, then notice nothing happen.
![autocompleteClickWorkaround](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11539520/54828279-d1735700-4c81-11e9-89a0-240c36fba1ea.gif)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular6, Material 6.4.7 and 7.2.0, Windows 7 and Linux, Firefox 60.5.2, Chrome 72.0.3626.121

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The user can enter a character or select up or down arrows to force the dropdown list to open after input has been cleared.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clicking autocomplete field after clear doesn't show dropdown list" (#15577)

Issues.Title: [Tabs] Slide animation for mat-tab-nav-bar
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request. It would be nice if there was an option on `nav[mat-tab-nav-bar]` with `a[mat-tab-link]`s that allowed it to animate the same way as a regular `` with `` elements. Currently, with something like the following, you get animations when switching between tabs: ```html

Some tab content

...

Some more tab content

...

 ``` However, if you switch to using a `` to navigate between tabs, you lose the slide in/out animation and must either forego the animation altogether or implement your own equivalent animation, which may make the UI inconsistent with other areas of your app that use `` unless you are able to reproduce the same effect 100% the same. ```html
{{link.label}}
``` #### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal? Say you have a user profile screen that is using `` to separate out various areas of your user profile. At one point, you may find that it is better for maintainability if each tab was its own component so you do not need to have one giant component with every piece of data that may show up across any of the tabs. This is also better if, for example, each tab fetches data from a different source and you'd like to delay that network call until navigating to the tab (although [lazy-loading](https://material.angular.io/components/tabs/overview#lazy-loading) may handle that as well). Also, in a lot of cases, it would be more ideal to be able to deep link into a given tab by using a ``, which is why `mat-tab-nav-bar` seems like a good fit for something like this. #### Is there anything else we should know? A work around may be to build separate components, have those components be within each ``, and then manually wire up the active tab state in the router via query string or route params. However, it looks like `mat-tab-nav-bar` was built specifically for this use-case, so it may be worth just baking the functionality into `mat-tab-nav-bar`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Tabs] Slide animation for mat-tab-nav-bar" (#15570)

Issues.Title: Click animations sometimes fire without firing click event
Issues.Body:
Occasionally, I'll click a button, tab, etc and see the animation fire, but the click event doesn't fire.

This causes an obviously broken feeling experience. Sometimes on a touch screen you might have to click things twice 'cause your finger didn't register or whatever, but when the animation plays, but the click event doesn't fire it's very obvious that your click was registered and it makes the app just look buggy.

#### What is the expected behavior?

Click event should fire when clicked and/or animation shouldn't play if the click event isn't fired.

#### What is the current behavior?

Sometimes click events don't fire when a button is clicked, but the material animation plays.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

https://angular-material2-issue-trsdzx.stackblitz.io

Load on mobile and click the button repeatedly. Pay attention to the count while clicking. On my phone I always see the animation without the count going up within the first 30 clicks.


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Latest version of angular / material (7.0.2).

Only seems to happen on mobile browsers. I've reproduced it on safari/ios and chrome/android.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Click animations sometimes fire without firing click event" (#15566)
